thread.title: Valentine's Day poems for him and her - Top 10 romantic wishes to write in your loved one's card

author: Ruth Halkon
title: Valentine's Day poems for him and her - Top 10 romantic wishes to write in your loved one's card
text:
Love letter: Here's what to write to make them smile (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
You've snared the perfect Valentine's gift, you've booked a table at that intimate restaurant and have got your hands on the perfect card that expresses just how you feel about your significant other. 
But there's one problem - you've no idea what to write inside. 
To help you express your feelings for your partner without sounding silly or trite, the Mirror has put together the best Valentine's Day wishes from writers who excel in the arts of love . 1. Elizabeth Barrett Browning 
I love you not only for what you are, but for what I am when I am with you. I love you not only for what you have made of yourself, but for what you are making of me. I love you for the part of me that you bring out. Read More 35 Valentine's Day cards and funny quotes you might not want to read on February 14th 2. Antoine de Saint-Exupery 
Life has taught us that love does not consist in gazing at each other but in looking outward in the same direction." ~ Antoine de Saint-Exupery
